required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Studying T Cells in Blood and Bone Marrow Samples From Patients With Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Strategies to Isolate and Expand Myeloma Specific T-cells Using Autologous B Cells as Antigen Presenting Cell B-APC

brief_summary.textblock:
RATIONALE: Studying samples of blood and bone marrow from patients with cancer in the laboratory may help doctors learn more about T cells and plan better treatment for multiple myeloma.
PURPOSE: This research study is looking at T cells in blood and bone marrow samples from patients with multiple myeloma.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:
Primary
- To evaluate the feasibility of expanding myeloma-specific T cells using autologous ex vivo expanded B cells loaded with myeloma antigens as antigen-presenting cells (B-APCs) in peripheral blood and bone marrow samples from patients with multiple myeloma.
Secondary
- To examine the feasibility of selecting and expanding myeloma-specific T cells ex vivo using interferon γ release and CD3/CD28 stimulation.
OUTLINE: Peripheral blood and bone marrow samples are collected periodically for laboratory studies. Samples are analyzed to assess the feasibility of expanding autologous B cells ex vivo using CD40L and IL-4; the antigen-presenting phenotype of autologous B-cell antigen-presenting cells (B-APCs) using flow cytometry; and the antigen-presenting function of B-APCs using ELISPOT and chromium-release assay. Myeloma-specific interferon γ secreting T cells are isolated and selected using Miltenyi beads. The selected myeloma-specific T cells are expanded ex vivo using anti CD3/CD28 beads.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Myeloma-specific T Cells ex Vivo Expanded Using Flow Cytometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: Collection of PBMCs over a period of 9-12 months, and the laboratory component will be performed over another year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cell Counts of Myeloma-specific T Cells ex Vivo Expanded Before and After CD3/CD28 Stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collection of PBMCs over a period of 9-12 months, and the laboratory component will be performed over another year.

clinical_study.condition: Multiple Myeloma and Plasma Cell Neoplasm

intervention.description: Collection of PBMCs over a period of 9-12 months, and the laboratory component will be performed over another year.
Collection of PBMCs over a period of 9-12 months, and the laboratory component will be performed over another year.
Collection of PBMCs over a period of 9-12 months, and the laboratory component will be performed over another year.

biospec_descr.textblock: Data from flow cytometry, and Cytokine release assays for B cells and T cells from peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) will be obtained.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a diagnosis of multiple myeloma identified from the outpatient clinics or inpatient service of Karmanos Cancer Center by physicians in the Department of Hematology and Medical Oncology.

criteria.textblock:
DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS:
- Diagnosis of multiple myeloma
PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS:
- Not specified
PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY:
- Not specified

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from the outpatient clinics or inpatient service of Karmanos Cancer Center by physicians in the Department of Hematology and Medical Oncology, between April 2008 and October 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All 6 consented subjects had blood drawn during their routine labs. No bone marrow samples were collected.

group.title: Collection of Circulating Blood and Bone Marrow.

participants_list.participants: None of the blood samples were analyzed due to lack of funding. No tissue sample was collected.
None of the blood samples were analyzed due to lack of funding. No tissue sample was collected

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Tis study was closed due to technical laboratory difficulty in performing the experiments proposed.
